annotation.summary: A character whose life was changed by a paradoxical event gains the ability to manipulate reality, exploring alternate timelines and creating spatial or temporal effects through focused magic anchored to a memory or concept.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Exposure to a paradoxical or reality-altering event

annotation.summary: At the first level, the character gains an attribute increase that can be applied to either Charisma or Intelligence, depending on their choice.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: character must be level 1 in the specified class

annotation.summary: The character's maximum hit points increase by a specified amount at 1st level and continue to increase by that same amount at each subsequent level.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level or higher

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to alter terrain and influence events by drawing on alternate realities, using powerful magic and relying on an anchor for stability when strained.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the specific spell or effect used
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to reality-altering magic and an established anchor

annotation.summary: The paragraph describes using logic, mathematics, and knowledge of the multiverse to solve problems.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: requires proficiency or training in knowledge-based or reasoning skills

annotation.summary: The character can detect and interpret magical auras, offering insights into supernatural occurrences and using spell gems to overcome or defend against environmental hazards.
annotation.action_economy: passive or exploration activity
annotation.prerequisites: ability to perceive or analyze magical auras; access to spell gems

annotation.summary: Describes a character who creates magical items for their group and may travel across dimensions or distant worlds during their training or adventures.
annotation.action_economy: Downtime activity; not tied to combat actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires knowledge or skill in magical crafting or item creation.

annotation.summary: The text instructs the reader to end or question a supernatural foresight effect or their perception of reality.
annotation.action_economy: free action
annotation.prerequisites: Must currently be under the effects of a precognition or reality-altering ability.

annotation.summary: Describes how a witchwarper character gains specific abilities as they level up, with higher-level abilities marked by their corresponding levels.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper class character.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains not only their class abilities but also the benefits granted by their chosen ancestry and background, which are detailed in Chapter 2.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level and have selected an ancestry and background.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains specific proficiency ranks in certain statistics, and is untrained in all others unless improved by another feature.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level

annotation.summary: The character gains training in a single skill, which is chosen based on their paradox feature or background.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a defined paradox to determine the skill.

annotation.summary: The character gains training in a number of extra skills determined by 3 plus their Intelligence modifier.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: The character has training proficiency with simple weapons and unarmed attacks.

A level progression table for the Witchwarper class, detailing features gained at each level such as spell ranks, feats, attribute boosts, skill increases, and class-specific abilities like paradox, anchor, quantum field, and quantum thesis.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section describes character progression rather than actions or combat mechanics.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a Witchwarper class to gain these features at the listed levels.

annotation.summary: Describes the key components that define a witchwarper character, including their ancestry, background, attribute boosts, proficiencies, and unique class features such as paradox, anchor, quantum field, and spellcasting repertoire.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section outlines character setup rather than actions in play.
annotation.prerequisites: None; these are baseline elements for creating or understanding a witchwarper character.

annotation.summary: Describes features available at the second rank, including general feats, isolated spell matrices, signature spells, and opportunities for skill increases.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 2nd rank or equivalent level

annotation.summary: At this level, the character gains access to 3rd-rank spells, selects an ancestry feat, applies attribute boosts, improves reflex saving throw proficiency to expert, and gains one skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive level-up benefits)
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level at which 3rd-rank spells and these benefits are granted.

annotation.summary: A general feat available to expert spellcasters who can cast 4th-rank spells, providing a skill increase.
The paragraph lists character progression elements available at a certain level, including access to 5th-rank spells, an ancestry feat, improved magical resilience, and a skill increase.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be of sufficient level to access 5th-rank spells and qualify for an ancestry feat and skill increase.

annotation.summary: The section grants the character an attribute boost and allows selection of both a skill feat and a witchwarper-specific feat.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be eligible for level-based advancement or class feature granting these options.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists advancements or requirements related to 6th-rank spells, a general feat, perception expertise, skill increases, and weapon expertise.
This section lists character advancements or features gained at 7th rank, including access to 7th-rank spells, an ancestry feat, improved defenses, a skill increase, and weapon specialization.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; these are passive or progression-based benefits rather than actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 7th rank or level.

annotation.summary: At 8th rank, the character gains access to 8th-level spells, an attribute boost, a general feat, the master spellcaster proficiency, and a skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive progression benefits)
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 8th rank or level.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists character progression elements available at higher levels, including access to 9th-rank spells, an ancestry feat, a quantum will feature, and a skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; these are level-based progression features rather than actions taken in play.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached a level where 9th-rank spells, ancestry feats, and skill increases are granted.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists character progression elements gained at a certain level: an attribute boost, a skill feat, and a witchwarper-specific feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a witchwarper of the appropriate level to gain these benefits.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains four free ability boosts in addition to those granted by their class.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains a set of proficiencies that reflect their initial training, as listed in the class description.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level in the class.

annotation.summary: The character’s origin involves temporal or dimensional anomalies, such as alternate realities, time glitches, or quantum magic, resulting in them becoming a living paradox.

At 1st level, the character selects a paradox that defines their magical tradition, trained skills, additional spells, and quantum field effects. This choice also grants Focus Points and unique warp focus spells tied to the chosen paradox.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: 1st-level character

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character chooses a personal anchor—an object, memory, or connection—that stabilizes their existence and ties them to reality.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to generate a quantum field shaped by paradoxical forces, manifesting visually in various ways. Its effects depend on the user's chosen paradox and can be enhanced through specific feats or warp spells. The field can be activated or maintained using reality-warping magic.
annotation.action_economy: Activation or extension requires the use of reality-warping magic; specific action type not stated.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a paradox and the ability to use witchwarper feats or warp spells.

annotation.summary: The character gains the Warp Reality action to activate their quantum field, with its trait determined by their chosen paradox tradition, and also gains Quantum Pulse to establish the field rapidly at combat start.
annotation.action_economy: Warp Reality is an action; Quantum Pulse occurs at the start of combat (likely a free or reaction-type effect).
annotation.prerequisites: Requires selection of a paradox tradition to determine the action's trait.

annotation.summary: The ability or action can only be used when the character's quantum field is currently inactive.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must not be active.

annotation.summary: Creates a 20‑foot‑radius quantum field within 100 feet that lasts until the end of your next turn or up to 10 minutes if Sustained. While active, it enables the use of anchoring‑trait actions and applies effects based on your paradox. You can choose which creatures are affected when the field is created, Sustained, or when they enter it, and you may reposition the field within 100 feet each time you Sustain it.
annotation.action_economy: Activation requires an action; maintaining it uses the Sustain action each round.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability or feature granting access to a quantum field and a defined paradox.

annotation.summary: The quantum field ends automatically if the user is unconscious, chooses to dismiss it, or moves over 100 feet away from it.
annotation.action_economy: Dismiss action
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be active

annotation.summary: At the start of combat, the character automatically triggers a burst of quantum energy, activating the Warp Reality effect without needing to take an action.
annotation.action_economy: automatic at start of combat
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use paradoxical or quantum powers

annotation.summary: The witchwarper channels paradoxical energy to cast spells using the Cast a Spell activity, often accompanied by vivid manifestations of alternate realities and mystical symbols.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a Spell activity (typically requires actions as defined by the spell)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper or possess the paradox ability

annotation.summary: The paragraph explains that a character can cast up to three 1st-rank spells per day, provided they know those spells through their spell repertoire. The daily limit of spells is referred to as spell slots.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; relates to daily spell usage rather than combat actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the spell repertoire class feature and know the spells to cast.

annotation.summary: As a witchwarper gains levels, they can cast more spells per day and gain access to higher-rank spells, according to a progression table.
annotation.action_economy: None
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a witchwarper and gain levels in the class.

annotation.summary: Explains how spell attacks and spell DCs are determined, noting that they rely on the caster's chosen key attribute (Charisma or Intelligence) and that further calculation details are provided elsewhere.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section describes calculations, not actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have chosen a key attribute (Charisma or Intelligence) for spellcasting.

annotation.summary: Explains how higher-rank spell slots can be used to cast lower-rank spells at increased power, provided the caster knows the spell at that higher rank.
annotation.action_economy: None (describes a casting option, not an action type)
annotation.prerequisites: Caster must have access to higher-rank spell slots and know the spell at the desired heightened rank.

annotation.summary: Cantrips are spells that can be cast freely without using spell slots and automatically scale in power with the caster’s level, being heightened to half the caster’s level (rounded up).
annotation.action_economy: Varies by specific cantrip; generally a standard spellcasting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells or possess a spellcasting class feature (e.g., witchwarper).

annotation.summary: Describes warp spells as a type of focus spell that costs 1 Focus Point to cast. The caster begins with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which can be refilled during daily preparations or by spending 10 minutes on the Refocus activity involving contemplation or research.
annotation.action_economy: 10 minutes for Refocus activity; casting costs 1 Focus Point
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast focus spells and access to warp spells

annotation.summary: Focus spells scale automatically with the caster’s level, do not use spell slots, and are fueled by a limited focus pool that can hold up to three Focus Points. Additional feats can grant more focus spells or expand the pool’s capacity.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by specific focus spell; not defined in this paragraph.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast focus spells and possess a focus pool.

annotation.summary: Warp spells possess the anchoring trait, restricting their use to when the caster's quantum field is active. Casting a warp spell also automatically sustains the quantum field.
annotation.action_economy: Casting a warp spell includes automatically sustaining the quantum field, removing the need for a separate sustain action.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be active to cast warp spells.

annotation.summary: The character gains access to warp spells determined by their paradox attribute or feature.
annotation.action_economy: None specified
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess or have a defined paradox value or feature

annotation.summary: At 1st level, you begin with a spell repertoire containing two 1st-rank spells, four cantrips, and one additional spell and cantrip from your paradox. You can cast any spell in this repertoire using a spell slot of the appropriate rank, and all spells must come from the tradition tied to your paradox.
annotation.action_economy: Casting a spell requires using a spell slot of the appropriate rank.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level and have a defined paradox to determine available spell traditions.

annotation.summary: As the character gains levels, they expand their spell repertoire by adding new spells corresponding to newly acquired spell slots. At specific levels, they gain additional spells of appropriate ranks, including the option to add heightened versions of existing spells.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive progression during level-up)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to spell slots and a spell repertoire.

annotation.summary: Spell slots and the spells in a spell repertoire are distinct; gaining one does not grant the other. Feats or abilities that add spells to the repertoire do not increase spell slots.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: ability to cast spells or have a spell repertoire

annotation.summary: When a character gains a level and learns new spells, they may replace one previously learned spell with another of the same rank, including cantrips. Spells granted by a paradox cannot be replaced. Spells can also be swapped through retraining during downtime.
annotation.action_economy: Downtime activity for retraining; automatic option upon leveling up
annotation.prerequisites: Character must gain a new level and learn new spells, or have access to downtime for retraining

annotation.summary: Starting at 2nd level and at each even-numbered level afterward, the character gains a skill feat, which requires being trained or better in the related skill.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be trained or better in the associated skill to select the skill feat.

annotation.summary: Starting at 2nd level and at every even-numbered level after that, the character gains a witchwarper class feat.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class, level 2 or higher

annotation.summary: The feature allows a character to channel spells into their quantum field, granting them access to a special action called Isolated Spell Matrix.
annotation.action_economy: Grants a new action: Isolated Spell Matrix
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells

annotation.summary: When you next cast a ranged spell, its range becomes 100 feet, but its effects are limited to your quantum field and cannot extend beyond it.
annotation.action_economy: applies to the next Cast a Spell action
annotation.prerequisites: must be able to cast a spell with a range

annotation.summary: Starting at 3rd level and every 4 levels after that, the character gains a general feat chosen from the list in Chapter 5.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at least 3rd level.

annotation.summary: This feature allows a spellcaster to designate one spell per spell rank as a signature spell, which can be freely heightened or cast at lower ranks without needing to learn each version separately. Signature spells can be swapped or retrained, maintaining their rank association.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells of at least one rank

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to replace a signature spell with another spell of the same rank, following the normal retraining time for spells.
annotation.action_economy: downtime activity (retraining duration)
annotation.prerequisites: must have a signature spell of the chosen rank

annotation.summary: The character gains additional ancestry feats at 5th level and every 4 levels after that, chosen from the ancestry's list in Chapter 2.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have an ancestry; applies starting at 5th level.

annotation.summary: Your magical training enhances your skill, raising your proficiency in class DC, spell attack modifier, and spell DC to expert level.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; prior proficiency below expert in class DC, spell attack modifier, and spell DC.

annotation.summary: The character becomes more vigilant, improving their Perception proficiency to the expert level.
annotation.action_economy: passive
annotation.prerequisites: trained in Perception

annotation.summary: The character's proficiency with simple weapons and unarmed attacks improves to the expert level.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Requires prior training or proficiency at a lower level (typically trained).

annotation.summary: The feature increases your proficiency in light armor and unarmored defense to the expert level, improving your ability to avoid attacks.
annotation.action_economy: passive
annotation.prerequisites: trained in light armor or unarmored defense

annotation.summary: Grants bonus damage with weapons or unarmed attacks based on proficiency level: +2 for expert, +3 for master, and +4 for legendary.
annotation.action_economy: passive
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency with at least one weapon or unarmed attack

annotation.summary: A progression table showing the number of spell slots or spell ranks available to a character at each level, from level 1 to 20. It details how many spells of each rank (cantrips through 10th rank) a character can cast as they advance in level.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this table defines spell slot progression rather than actions in combat.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have a spellcasting class or feature that uses this spell rank progression.

annotation.summary: The character's spellcasting capabilities improve, raising their proficiency ranks for class DC, spell attack modifier, and spell DC to master level.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have spellcasting abilities and existing proficiency ranks below master.

annotation.summary: Grants access to two common 10th-rank spells of the character's tradition and provides one 10th-rank spell slot usable only for those spells. The slot cannot be modified or replenished by other abilities, and additional 10th-rank slots can only be gained through the Quantum Research feat.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell cast using the 10th-rank slot
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells of the specified tradition; witchwarper spellcasting

annotation.summary: The character expands their quantum field to a 100-foot radius and gains the ability to selectively exclude any number of squares from its area when activating or sustaining it.
annotation.action_economy: Activate or Sustain action required to modify the field's area.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have previously established and mastered a quantum field ability.

annotation.summary: The character’s paradox defines their magical origin, determining their spellcasting tradition, granting proficiency in a specific skill, and automatically adding related paradox spells to their repertoire. They begin with an initial warp spell and can later gain advanced versions through specific feats. Their quantum field also gains a unique effect tied to the chosen paradox.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; effects are passive or determined by spell use.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must select a paradox as part of their class or background features.

annotation.summary: This entry defines the tradition as Arcane and associates the Paradox skill with Computers.
Lists the sequence of Paradox Spells available by spell level, from cantrip through 9th level, each providing progressively greater insight, perception, and manipulation of reality and time.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; typically one action to cast unless otherwise specified.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells from the Paradox tradition or have access to Paradox Spells.

annotation.summary: A progression of warp-related spells that manipulate probability and outcomes, culminating in advanced quantum-level analysis.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell tier; each likely requires a standard casting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Warp Spells discipline or equivalent magical training.

annotation.summary: Introduces key terminology commonly used in witchwarper abilities.

Abilities with the anchoring trait can only be used while the user's quantum field is active. When used on the user's turn, these abilities also automatically sustain the quantum field in addition to their normal effects.
annotation.action_economy: Occurs on the user's turn; automatically sustains the quantum field without requiring a separate action.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be activated before using an ability with the anchoring trait.

annotation.summary: Spellshape actions modify the effects of spells and must be used immediately before casting the spell they alter. Any other action taken before casting negates the modification, and the added effects are considered part of the spell itself.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an action immediately before casting a spell; no other actions can occur between the spellshape and the spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a spellshape feat or ability granting a spellshape action.

annotation.summary: Zone actions add a special effect to a quantum field, but only if that field does not already have a zone effect applied.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Target quantum field must not already have a zone effect

annotation.summary: Quantum Field allows a character to apply the results of a Seek or Recall Knowledge action to two related targets within their quantum field. Additionally, when sustaining the quantum field, the character can perform a Seek or Recall Knowledge action as a free action against a target in that field.

action_economy.sustain: free action to Seek or Recall Knowledge

prerequisites: ability to create or maintain a quantum field

annotation.summary: Describes a character whose very being is out of place in their current reality, possibly due to exposure to alternate dimensions or temporal distortions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have a backstory involving dimensional or temporal disruption.

annotation.summary: This entry defines a magical tradition as Arcane and associates it with the Paradox skill Deception.
A list of Paradox Spells organized by spell level, ranging from the cantrip 'stumble' to the 9th-level 'call cosmos'.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; not specified in this entry.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Paradox Spells or a class feature that grants them.

annotation.summary: A progression of warp-related spells that begin with altering terrain, advance to reshaping entire worlds, and culminate in creating or interacting with parallel forms or realities.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell level; typically requires a standard or full action to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Caster must have access to warp magic or transmutation spell list; higher tiers require mastery of previous warp spells.

annotation.summary: The Quantum Field creates a distortion that interferes with enemies' focused actions. When an enemy within the field tries to perform a concentrate action, they must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or have their action disrupted. Once a creature fails this check, it gains temporary immunity to the effect for 24 hours.
annotation.action_economy: Passive effect; triggers when an enemy in the field attempts a concentrate action.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability or feature that creates or maintains a quantum field.

annotation.summary: This entry defines the tradition as occult and identifies Society as the associated Paradox Skill.
A list of Paradox-themed spells organized by spell level, ranging from a cantrip to 9th level, each representing increasingly powerful manipulations of mind, matter, and reality.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; typically one action to cast unless otherwise specified.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells and access to the Paradox spell list.

annotation.summary: A progression of warp-themed spells that begin with altering presence, advance to causing forgetfulness, and culminate in erasing reality itself.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell level; each likely requires a standard casting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to warp magic or equivalent spellcasting tradition.

annotation.summary: Creates a supernatural field that conceals the user from nearby creatures, granting concealment until struck by an attack from one of them.
annotation.action_economy: passive
annotation.prerequisites: ability to generate a quantum field or similar feature

annotation.summary: The character has become displaced in time, originating from another era or timeline, and now possesses the rare ability to perceive and manipulate temporal flow.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have experienced a temporal displacement or event that caused them to become unstuck in time.

annotation.summary: This entry defines an occult tradition that uses Piloting as its associated Paradox skill.
Lists the progression of Paradox Spells available at each spell level, from the cantrip Injury Echo up to the 9th-level spell Foresight.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; not specified in this entry.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Paradox Spells feature or class granting these spells.

annotation.summary: A progression of time-manipulating spells that begin with basic warping of time, advance to accelerating temporal flow, and culminate in creating repeating time loops.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell level; each likely requires a standard casting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to time or warp magic discipline; advancement requires mastery of previous spell tier.

annotation.summary: The Quantum Field ability manipulates time around the user, slowing enemies and hastening allies within its area. Enemies moving inside the field have their Speed reduced, while allies gain increased Speed for their movement.
annotation.action_economy: Passive effect; applies automatically when creatures move within the field.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Quantum Field ability or feature.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, you choose an anchor that stabilizes your quantum field and mitigates paradox effects. The anchor provides a specific benefit and an anchoring effect that activates when you Sustain your quantum field, interacting with abilities that have the anchoring trait.
annotation.action_economy: Occurs when you use the Sustain action on your quantum field.
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level; must have access to a quantum field feature.

annotation.summary: During daily preparations, the character selects a trained skill to gain the Assurance feat for it. If the character is an expert in that skill and it supports Recall Knowledge, they also gain the Automatic Knowledge ability for that skill.
annotation.action_economy: None (applies during daily preparations)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be trained in the chosen skill; expert rank required to gain Automatic Knowledge if applicable.

annotation.summary: Anchoring Effect allows a character to lessen their stupefied condition by 1, but only once each round.
annotation.action_economy: none (passive or triggered effect, limited to once per round)
annotation.prerequisites: must currently have the stupefied condition

annotation.summary: The paragraph instructs the reader to consult a table listing witchwarper feats organized by name.

A list of advanced feats related to quantum or warp-based magic, each with an associated level requirement. The feats range from basic abilities like Anchoring Strike and Borrow Spell to powerful options such as Infinite Magic and Complete Transposition, suggesting a progression of magical mastery and dimensional manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; not specified in the provided text.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat likely requires a minimum character level as indicated by the numbers following their names.

annotation.summary: Describes how a character’s focal point can stem from diverse inspirations, including academic fields, abstract ideas, personal interests, or media influences, potentially tied to paradoxes and alternate realities.
Allows a caster to maintain concentration on a spell despite disruption by making a DC 15 flat check when a reaction would interrupt spellcasting.
annotation.action_economy: Passive benefit triggered by a reaction that would disrupt spellcasting.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the Anchor Benefit feature or ability.

annotation.summary: Temporarily lessens the clumsy condition by 1 and negates the suppressed condition until the start of the next turn, usable once per round.
annotation.action_economy: unspecified (likely a reaction or free action, usable once per round)
annotation.prerequisites: must have the clumsy or suppressed condition

annotation.summary: Provides a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks and Will saves against illusions and holograms due to the grounding effect of a chosen anchor object.
annotation.action_economy: passive
annotation.prerequisites: must have a chosen anchor object

annotation.summary: Anchoring Effect allows a character to lessen their frightened condition by 1, or if not frightened, gain temporary bonuses to Will saves against fear and to Will DC against Demoralize attempts until the start of their next turn. The effect can only apply once per round.
annotation.action_economy: none or passive (limited to once per round)
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: Indicates that whenever a character gains a witchwarper feat, they may choose a new feat option associated with that class level.
annotation.action_economy: None (applies during level-up, not during combat)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper gaining a new feat level

annotation.summary: A list of feats and abilities from a tabletop role-playing game, each paired with a level requirement, likely representing character progression or unlock levels for quantum- or magic-themed powers.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; likely varies by individual feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat appears to require the listed level as a prerequisite.

annotation.summary: Indicates that a character can choose one feat from a list, provided all prerequisites for that feat are met before selection.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the specific requirements of the chosen feat before selection.

annotation.summary: Anchoring Strike is a level 1 feat that requires one action to use. The name suggests it involves a physical or magical attack that restricts or immobilizes a target.
annotation.action_economy: one-action
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper class feature or ability called Flourish Fortune, likely involving manipulation of luck or probability through magical or dimensional means.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class

annotation.summary: The ability or action can only be used if the character currently has their quantum field active.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be active.

annotation.summary: On a critical success, the attack gains the anchoring trait and the attacker may reroll the damage dice, keeping the second result.
annotation.action_economy: N/A
annotation.prerequisites: Must achieve a critical success on the Strike.

annotation.summary: On a successful action, the character's Strike attack gains the anchoring trait.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: A successful Strike roll

annotation.summary: The quantum field's area is treated as difficult terrain due to environmental or quantum disturbances.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive or ongoing effect)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability or feature that creates a quantum field

annotation.summary: This entry lists the traits associated with a Witchwarper spellshape action, indicating it requires concentration, involves manipulation, and is specific to the Witchwarper class.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the specific spellshape action; typically requires at least one action to perform.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper or have access to Witchwarper spellshape abilities.

annotation.summary: The character can harness a temporal anomaly to cast magic that manipulates time.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the specific time manipulation spell or ability used.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a connection to a temporal anomaly or similar source of time-based power.

annotation.summary: Advises players to focus on increasing Intelligence first, followed by Dexterity and Wisdom, to enhance defensive capabilities.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: Lists the 1st-level spells and cantrips available to the character, including akashic download, mind skewer, fleet step, and several cantrips focused on analysis, measurement, and telekinetic effects.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically 2 actions for most spells unless otherwise specified.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to spellcasting class or feature that grants 1st-level spells and cantrips.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper ability that modifies or shapes a spell through concentration, likely altering its effects or area while maintaining focus.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; typically uses a standard or move action depending on the specific spellshape effect.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to the Spellshape class feature or ability.

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to increase the range of their next spell by 30 feet, or to change a touch-range spell to a 30-foot range.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action or activity used before casting a spell
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells

annotation.summary: A level 1 feat named Soothing Anchor that requires one action to use.
annotation.action_economy: one-action

annotation.summary: The ability can only be used if your previous action involved sustaining your quantum field or if the action had the anchoring trait.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; applies as a prerequisite condition for the next action.
annotation.prerequisites: Your last action must have been to sustain your quantum field or possess the anchoring trait.

annotation.summary: The character focuses on their anchor to calm themselves, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to their witchwarper level for 1 round.
annotation.action_economy: likely a standard or move action depending on context
annotation.prerequisites: must have an anchor and be a witchwarper

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper spellshape effect that requires the caster to concentrate to maintain or modify a spell’s parameters.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; typically uses a standard or focus action depending on the spellshape used.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the Witchwarper class and the ability to use spellshape effects.

annotation.summary: The feature allows the character to learn two extra cantrips from their spell list, expanding their available simple spells.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: ability to cast cantrips or have a spell list

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper spellshape ability that requires concentration to maintain its effects.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; typically uses a standard action to activate or maintain.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper class character with access to spellshape abilities.

annotation.summary: This ability activates when another creature, trap, or object within your quantum field casts a spell that you do not know, provided you notice the casting.
annotation.action_economy: reaction
prerequisites: must be aware of the spell being cast

annotation.summary: A witchwarper ability that involves manipulating or shaping spells, likely altering their effects or areas.
annotation.action_economy: manipulate
annotation.prerequisites: witchwarper class

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to modify their next damaging spell (excluding those with death or void traits) so that it deals nonlethal damage instead.
annotation.action_economy: Applies to the next Cast a Spell action
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast a spell that deals damage and lacks the death or void trait

annotation.summary: The ability or action can only be used if the character currently has their quantum field active.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be active.

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to instantly teleport up to their Speed within a defined area, avoiding hazards, terrain, and movement-triggered reactions, but cannot pass through solid barriers.
annotation.action_economy: varies (likely one action or reaction depending on context)
annotation.prerequisites: must have a defined quantum field or similar ability area

annotation.summary: The rule requires that the character or entity be affected by or connected to a Gap-influenced paradox before the ability or feature can be used.
This ability activates when you or an ally within your quantum field fails a saving throw against a mental effect.
annotation.action_economy: reaction
annotation.prerequisites: You must have an active quantum field.

annotation.summary: When an enemy or ally is within your quantum field, you can shift realities so that another version of events absorbs part of the harm. You reduce the damage you take from a triggering attack by half your level, and another creature in your field takes that amount of damage instead, with a basic Fortitude save against your class DC.
annotation.action_economy: reaction
annotation.prerequisites: An enemy or willing ally must be within your quantum field.

annotation.summary: The ability or action can only be used when the character's quantum field is currently active.
annotation.prerequisites: Quantum field must be active.

annotation.summary: The character focuses on pleasant thoughts, gaining a temporary +2 status bonus to saving throws against mental effects until the start of their next turn.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to take mental actions or concentrate

annotation.summary: The effect activates when you cast a spell of 2nd rank or higher that targets a creature or area within your quantum field.
annotation.action_economy: reaction
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-rank or higher spells and have a defined quantum field.

annotation.summary: The paragraph begins to describe a character's ability to control or alter a quantum field, likely granting them a special effect or power.
annotation.action_economy: unspecified
annotation.prerequisites: unspecified

annotation.summary: A level 4 feat that allows the user to imbue ammunition with magical energy as a free action, enhancing its effects when fired.
annotation.action_economy: Free Action
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: A level 6 feat that allows the character to expand or enhance a quantum field effect using a single action.
annotation.action_economy: one action
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to quantum field abilities or prior related feats.

annotation.summary: Anchoring is a witchwarper ability that requires concentration, likely used to stabilize or fix a location, object, or effect within the game’s reality-altering mechanics.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; likely a standard or focus action depending on system rules.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper class or possess equivalent class feature access.

annotation.summary: Expands the quantum field's radius by 10 feet initially, and each time the field is sustained, its radius increases by another 5 feet, up to a total of 50 additional feet before deactivation.
annotation.action_economy: Once per turn when sustaining the quantum field
annotation.prerequisites: Active quantum field

annotation.summary: When activating Warp Reality, the user can choose to make their quantum field an aura that moves with them, turning the effect into a 10-foot-radius emanation centered on the user.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the same action as Warp Reality; no additional actions required.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the Warp Reality ability.

annotation.summary: The character's paradox becomes more established, granting them access to the advanced warp spell associated with their paradox.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess a paradox feature

annotation.summary: Creates a hazardous area that deals 1 damage of a chosen type to enemies entering affected squares, with damage increasing at higher levels.
annotation.action_economy: unspecified (likely standard or special action to activate)
annotation.prerequisites: ability to use Danger Zone feature

annotation.summary: Anchoring is a witchwarper ability that requires concentration, likely used to stabilize or fix a location, object, or effect in place through magical or dimensional manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: requires concentration (typically a standard or focus action)
annotation.prerequisites: must be a witchwarper class or have access to witchwarper abilities

annotation.summary: Creatures within your quantum field must succeed at a Will save to leave it; failure prevents movement outside the field, and success grants immunity for 24 hours.
annotation.action_economy: Passive effect lasting until the start of your next turn
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to create or maintain a quantum field; witchwarper class feature

annotation.summary: The character unlocks a deeper level of paradoxical insight, gaining access to the greater warp spell associated with their paradox.
annotation.action_economy: None specified; effect occurs upon gaining the ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess a paradox feature or class ability that allows gaining spells.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper ability that modifies or enhances a spell through concentration, altering its effects or parameters during casting.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration as part of the spellcasting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to Spellshape abilities.

annotation.summary: Allows a witchwarper to reduce the casting time of a lower-rank spell or cantrip by one action, as long as it is at least two ranks lower than their highest available spell slot.
annotation.action_economy: Reduces the number of actions required to cast an eligible spell by 1 (minimum 1 action).
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper with access to spell slots; the next spell cast must be at least two ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot available.

annotation.summary: Anchoring is a Witchwarper ability that involves focusing magical energy to stabilize or fix a specific area or effect in place, often creating a persistent zone of altered reality.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a concentrate and manipulate action, typically taking one action to perform.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to Witchwarper class features or spells that create zones or anchored effects.

annotation.summary: You project your quantum field onto an ally, allowing them to benefit from it and serve as the origin point for your warp spells until the field ends. You must still maintain line of sight to your targets.
annotation.action_economy: likely a standard or focus action to activate (depends on system context)
annotation.prerequisites: must have an active quantum field and an ally within line of sight

annotation.summary: Anchoring Darkness is a Witchwarper ability that creates a zone of supernatural shadow, hindering movement or visibility within its area.
annotation.action_economy: Standard action
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class feature or access to darkness-based spells

annotation.summary: Creates an area of magical darkness that also induces confusion in creatures failing a Will save against the user's class DC. Critical success grants temporary immunity, and the darkness effect can be counteracted without removing other field effects.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified in the paragraph
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an active quantum field; access to 2nd-rank darkness effect

annotation.summary: Anchoring Light is a Witchwarper ability that creates a localized zone of stabilizing energy, often used to hinder teleportation or planar movement within its area.
annotation.action_economy: Standard action
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class; access to appropriate level spell or class feature enabling zone creation

annotation.summary: Creates a bright light field that forces creatures starting their turn within it to make a Fortitude save against your class DC, with light-blind creatures suffering worse results.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to create or maintain a quantum field

annotation.summary: This effect occurs when you take an action to sustain your quantum field while it remains active.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered by sustaining an ongoing effect
annotation.prerequisites: You must have an active quantum field and use an action to sustain it.

annotation.summary: This feat allows a spellcaster with a paradoxical nature to add one spell from outside their normal spellcasting tradition to their repertoire. The chosen spell is treated as part of their tradition, becomes a signature spell, and can be changed upon leveling up.
annotation.action_economy: None (passive feat benefit)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a paradoxical nature and access to a spell repertoire

annotation.summary: A level 14 feat named Persistent Quantum Field that requires two actions to activate. The details of its effects are not provided in the excerpt.
annotation.action_economy: two-actions
annotation.prerequisites: Not specified

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to generate a stable quantum field, temporarily warping reality for one minute.
annotation.action_economy: unspecified
annotation.prerequisites: none stated

annotation.summary: Requires the character to be a master in a paradox skill that is not associated with their chosen paradox.
annotation.prerequisites: Master in a paradox skill for a paradox other than the chosen paradox.

annotation.summary: Allows the character to swap one paradox spell for another during daily preparations, provided the new spell's paradox grants training in the required skill.
annotation.action_economy: No action (occurs during daily preparations)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to paradox spells and training in the prerequisite paradox skill

annotation.summary: The ability or action can only be used if the character currently has an active quantum field that influences at least one zone.
annotation.prerequisites: An active quantum field with one affected zone.

annotation.summary: Allows the caster to overlap a second zone with their existing quantum field, either adding a new zone or enhancing the current one with stronger effects depending on the zone type.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (depends on how zones are normally created or maintained)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have an active quantum field and the ability to create or maintain zones

annotation.summary: A witchwarper ability that prevents or restricts teleportation or dimensional travel within a certain area or around a target.
annotation.action_economy: varies; typically a standard or reaction depending on ability version
annotation.prerequisites: witchwarper class feature or access to dimensional magic

annotation.summary: When sustaining your quantum field, you can teleport any number of creatures and their carried items from the field's original area to its new area. Each target can attempt a Will save against your class DC to resist the effect. The Sustain action gains the teleportation trait.
annotation.action_economy: Sustain action
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to create and sustain a quantum field

annotation.summary: Allows the caster to cast two additional spells per day, each of a different rank up to 9th, even after expending all normal spell slots of those ranks.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the normal casting time of the chosen spell; limited to twice per day.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells of up to 9th rank.

annotation.summary: The character transcends mortal limits and gains one extra 10th-level spell slot.
annotation.action_economy: none
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to 10th-rank spells or equivalent power level.
